definitions.definition: A circumstance in which a choice must be made between two or more alternatives that seem equally undesirable .
A type of syllogism of the form "if A is true then B is true; if C is true then D is true; either A or C is true; therefore either B or D is true".
Offering to an opponent a choice between two (equally unfavorable) alternatives.

main_definition: A circumstance in which a choice must be made between two or more alternatives that seem equally undesirable .
secondary_definitions: ( logic ) A type of syllogism of the form "if A is true then B is true; if C is true then D is true; either A or C is true; therefore either B or D is true".
( rhetoric ) Offering to an opponent a choice between two (equally unfavorable) alternatives.
